articles.author: DeFi Pulse 🍇
articles.description:
Re 13/ 
If this thread helped you to understand recent concerns and discussions about $UST and stablecoins in general, like it and share!
articles.title: Re 13/ If this thread helped you to understand recent concerns and discussions about $UST and stablecoins in general, like it and share!

articles.author: DeFi Pulse 🍇
articles.description:
Re 12/ Decentralized algorithm, centralized collateral 👀
The algorithm that controls $UST is decentralized, but the $BTC reserve “in case something goes wrong” is controlled by an entity.
Because of recent volatility, they've announced a $1.5B deployment. https://twitter.com/stablekwon/status/1523532476898897920
articles.title: Re 12/ Decentralized algorithm, centralized collateral 👀 The algorithm that controls $UST is decentralized, but the $BTC reserve “in case somethin...

articles.author: DeFi Pulse 🍇
articles.description:
Re 11/ Decentralized and unbiased
Maker's vaults are controlled by smart-contracts. The collateral management, liquidation process, price checks, everything is decentralized. Emergency processes can be triggered by the DAO, a decentralized entity.
What about $UST?
articles.title: Re 11/ Decentralized and unbiased Maker's vaults are controlled by smart-contracts. The collateral management, liquidation process, price checks, ever...

articles.author: DeFi Pulse 🍇
articles.description:
Re 10/ Collateral-backed
Each $DAI in circulation is backed by a diverse class of cryptoassets. If your vault collateralization drops from a certain amount (from 130 to 150%) you're liquidated.
$UST peg is maintained by an algorithm, but there is a $BTC reserve in case it fails.
articles.title: Re 10/ Collateral-backed Each $DAI in circulation is backed by a diverse class of cryptoassets. If your vault collateralization drops from a certain a...

articles.author: DeFi Pulse 🍇
articles.description:
Re 9/ With that risk in mind, the Luna Foundation Guard had raised over $1B through private token sales to build a crypto reserve to support $UST. 
So now the algo stable is also… collateralized? 🤔
Let's recap $DAI's main features and compare with $UST. https://twitter.com/LFG_org/status/1512113288804552717
articles.title: Re 9/ With that risk in mind, the Luna Foundation Guard had raised over $1B through private token sales to build a crypto reserve to support $UST. So ...

articles.author: DeFi Pulse 🍇
articles.description: Re 8/ As we've experienced before with $FEI, a Black Swan event or just a strong bearish sentiment could cause a large sell pressure on both $UST and $LUNA assets, causing a "death spiral". https://twitter.com/WestieCapital/status/1496223640534323200
articles.title: Re 8/ As we've experienced before with $FEI, a Black Swan event or just a strong bearish sentiment could cause a large sell pressure on both $UST and ...

articles.author: DeFi Pulse 🍇
articles.description:
Re 7/ Collateralized x Algorithmic
This is where both solutions differentiate the most. While Maker protocol holds a higher amount of dollars in cryptoassets than $DAI in circulation, $UST relies on human reaction facing supply/demands fluctuation.
But humans are not perfect.
articles.title: Re 7/ Collateralized x Algorithmic This is where both solutions differentiate the most. While Maker protocol holds a higher amount of dollars in crypt...

articles.author: DeFi Pulse 🍇
articles.description:
Re 6/ To implement the elastic supply mechanism, Terra uses its governance coin, $LUNA.
In the Terra Blockchain, users can always swap $1 worth of $LUNA to 1 $UST and vice-versa, incentivizing arbitrageurs to take action in case the peg is lost.
articles.title: Re 6/ To implement the elastic supply mechanism, Terra uses its governance coin, $LUNA. In the Terra Blockchain, users can always swap $1 worth of $LU...

articles.author: DeFi Pulse 🍇
articles.description:
Re 5/  When writing an algorithm for a stablecoin, projects usually try to work with variations of a demand/supply mechanisms.  
It's intuitive if u think about it: if the coin drops in price, let's burn some of it, creating a shortage of supply. But $UST adds some details.
